alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 19 at 2:27PM MST until August 19 at 6:45PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Arizona, including the following county, Pima. * WHEN...Until 530 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 223 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated between 0.50 and 1.50 inches of heavy rain due showers and thunderstorms across southeast Pima county. The heaviest rainfall has occurred near Sahuarita, Green Valley and Corona de Tucson. Rainfall runoff will likely impact roadway dips and other low-lying areas with significant ponding of water. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sahuarita, Green Valley, Vail, East Sahuarita, Corona De Tucson and Summit. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
